ollama_generated:
ODM - PURCHASE AGREEMENT BETWEEN:

The essential difference lies in the title itself, as "Supply Agreement" implies that one party is supplying goods or services to another, while a "Purchase Agreement" suggests the reverse: one party is purchasing from another. Here's how I would rewrite the original clause to weaken an obligation:

ODM - PURCHASE AGREEMENT BETWEEN:

Party A (the Buyer) and Party B (the Seller) hereby agree as follows:

1. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Seller agrees to make its best effort to provide the Products specified in Schedule A, within the timeframes outlined therein, but shall not be liable for any delays due to unforeseen circumstances beyond its reasonable control.

By contrast, the original clause stated an obligation without qualification: "The Seller agrees to supply..." In the revised clause, I added the phrase "make its best effort" and introduced a condition (delays caused by unforeseen circumstances) under which the obligation is not met. This weakening of the obligation makes the clause more realistic, as it recognizes that even with the best intentions, external factors can interfere with the performance of an agreement.

BETWEEN: ORGANIC PREPARATIONS INC., hereinafter referred to as the "Supplier,"

In case of any disputes or disagreements arising out of this agreement, it shall be the exclusive responsibility of the Recipient, hereafter known as the "Client," to initiate a resolution process within thirty (30) calendar days from the date when the Client became aware of such dispute. The Supplier will then have seventy-five (75) business days, commencing from the date the Client initiates the process, to respond in good faith and provide a mutually acceptable resolution. If no agreement is reached within this timeframe, both parties shall engage a neutral third-party mediator at their joint expense, with the aim of resolving the dispute amicably and efficiently.

Should the dispute remain unresolved even after mediation, either party reserves the right to seek legal recourse through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules set forth by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) or any other mutually agreed-upon governing body. The decision rendered by the arbitrator shall be final and binding on both parties, and judgment upon the award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.

By executing this agreement, both parties acknowledge and agree to these dispute resolution provisions, understanding that they are intended to minimize the risk of lengthy and costly litigation.

original: RECITALS a.The Manufacturer wishes to appoint the Customer to be the sole and exclusive agent for the promotion, sales, marketing distribution and administration of the Products listed in schedule A of this agreement.
ollama_generated:
RECITALS b. The Customer desires to serve as the exclusive representative, on an appointed basis, for the purpose of promoting, selling, marketing, distributing, and administrating the Products specified in schedule A of this accord, under the Manufacturer's guidance and supervision.

This revised clause changes the obligation from the Manufacturer appointing the Customer to be the sole agent, to the Customer desiring to serve as the exclusive representative on an appointed basis, under the Manufacturer's guidance and supervision. This shift in language weakens the implication of appointment by the Manufacturer and emphasizes the Customer's role as a representative, acting with the Manufacturer's guidance.

original: 1.3 Renewal This agreement will be automatically renewed at the end of every ten (10) year term, with each subsequent term of renewal being for a ten (10) year term. A six (6) months notice must be given by either party of their intention to terminate relations due to any reason other than breach of this agreement.
ollama_generated:
1.3 Term Extension
This agreement shall extend automatically at the conclusion of each ten (10) year period, with each subsequent extension lasting for a period of five (5) years. Either party may choose to terminate the agreement by providing a notice of six (6) months prior to the commencement of the next period, solely for reasons not related to a breach of this contract. The option to terminate shall remain effective irrespective of whether the termination is initiated at the start or in the middle of any extension period.

original: (ii) The remaining 50% of the total order cost must be paid prior to the goods leaving the warehouse of the manufacturer. The Manufacturer will notify the Customer when the goods are ready for shipment prior to the goods leaving the warehouse.
ollama_generated: (ii) Upon receipt of notification from the Manufacturer that the goods are ready for shipment, the Customer shall have 48 hours to complete payment for the remaining 50% of the total order cost. If the payment is not received within this timeframe, the Manufacturer reserves the right to cancel the order and repossess any goods already prepared for shipment without further liability or obligation. The Customer acknowledges that they are responsible for any additional costs incurred due to the cancellation and repossession of the goods.

original: 7.3 Rights to termination Without prejudice to any right or remedy both parties may have against each other for breach or non-performance of this Agreement each party shall have the right to summarily terminate this Agreement:
ollama_generated:
7.3 Termination with Preservation of Rights:
With no limitation on any rights or remedies either party may pursue for a breach or non-compliance with this Agreement, each party retains the discretionary power to terminate this Agreement at will: Any such termination shall not serve as an admission or waiver of any past, present, or future breaches or non-performance by either party.

original: The termination of this agreement shall be without prejudice to the rights of either party to payment or other claims due or accrued up to the termination of this agreement.
ollama_generated: Upon the termination of this agreement, neither party shall forfeit their right to receive payments or assert any outstanding or future claims arising prior to the effective date of termination. This clause is intended to preserve and protect each party's rights pertaining to compensation and disputes that arose during the duration of this agreement.

original: 10. GOVERNING LAW This agreement shall be governed by the Laws of England (English common and statutory Law).
modified:
10. APPLICABLE LAW This agreement is subject to the jurisdiction and interpretation of the Courts of England, in accordance with both their common and statutory legal frameworks.

Changes made: Inverted the structure of the clause, placing emphasis on the courts rather than the laws themselves. This slightly weakens the obligation as it now implies that the agreement is subject to the courts' interpretation rather than a direct application of the English laws.

original: 11. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY The Manufacturer is the owner of the intellectual Property pertaining to the products listed in schedule A of this agreement as well as to the book ‘How to Achieve Super Health beyond 2000 – Advanced Edition’ ODM Supply Agreement 7 Organic Preparations INC. & Agape ATP International Holding Limited Source: AGAPE ATP CORP, 10-K/A, 12/2/2019 12. TRANSFER OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY The Manufacturer agrees to offer the Customer the first right of refusal to purchase the intellectual property for the products listed in Schedule A of this agreement based upon agreed terms.
ollama_generated:
11. OWNERSHIP AND LICENSE OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
The Manufacturer retains ownership of the intellectual property pertaining to the products outlined in Schedule A of this contract, as well as the book 'How to Achieve Super Health beyond 2000 – Advanced Edition'. However, the Manufacturer grants the Customer a non-exclusive, irrevocable, worldwide license to use these intellectual properties for the production and distribution of the agreed products.

12. OPTION TO ACQUIRE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
The Customer shall have the option to acquire the intellectual property rights related to the products listed in Schedule A of this agreement under mutually agreed terms. If the Customer elects not to exercise this option, the Manufacturer reserves the right to license these intellectual properties to third parties for commercial purposes.

original: 14.4 Severability If any provision of this agreement is held to be invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction, then the remaining provisions will nevertheless remain in full force and effect. The parties agree to renegotiate in good faith those provisions so held to be invalid to be valid, enforceable provisions which provisions shall reflect as closely as possible the original intent of the parties, and further agree to be bound by the mutually agreed substitute provisions.
ollama_generated: 14.4 Partial Invalidity: In the event that any provision of this agreement is deemed unenforceable or void by a court of competent jurisdiction, such determination shall not affect the remaining portions of this agreement, which shall continue to be in full force and effect. The parties acknowledge their responsibility to collaborate in good faith to reform the questionable provisions so as to create valid, enforceable alternatives that maintain, as closely as legally permissible, the original intent of the parties. Each party agrees to abide by these substituted provisions upon mutual agreement between them.

original: Where the occurrence of one of the above events is to any extent as a result of an act or omission of the breaching party, this section will not apply.
modified: Should any event enumerated herein transpire partially or fully due to the actions or inactions of the non-breaching party, the applicability of this section shall be waived and instead, the breaching party's liability for any damages or losses shall be considered.

original: 14.10 HOW TO ACHIEVE SUPER HEALTH BEYOND 2000 – ADVANCED EDITION BOOK The Manufacturer has appointed the Customer the copyright holder of both the English and the Chinese version of the book How to achieve Super Health beyond 2000 – Advanced Edition, authored by Frank D.P. Ellis and Dr. Michael Tait M.D. This appointment shall be deemed valid provided the Customer fulfils and maintains the criteria of this agreement.
ollama_generated: 14.10 RIGHTS TO THE BOOK "HOW TO ACHIEVE SUPER HEALTH BEYOND 2000 – ADVANCED EDITION" - The Customer shall be granted the copyright ownership of both the English and Chinese versions of the book authored by Frank D.P. Ellis and Dr. Michael Tait M.D., titled "How to achieve Super Health beyond 2000 – Advanced Edition." This granting is contingent upon the Manufacturer's satisfaction that the Customer has complied with, and will continue to comply with, the terms and conditions of this agreement. The copyright transfer shall not be effective if the Customer fails to meet these obligations.

Waiver of Common Seal Requirement for Organic Preparations Inc.

In the event that the execution of this Agreement by Organic Preparations Inc. does not require its Common Seal, it shall be permissible for the Company to sign and deliver this Agreement by an officer of the Company duly authorized in writing to execute agreements on behalf of the Company.

This waiver is intended to provide flexibility in executing documents, allowing the Company to act promptly without delay due to the absence or unavailability of the Common Seal. However, for legal certainty and validity, the use of the Common Seal shall still be preferred whenever possible.

original: was hereunto affixed in the presence ofDuly authorized to sign on behalf of Organic Preparations INC.
ollama_generated:
The following document was appended under the observation of an individual duly authorized to represent Organic Preparations, Inc., with full knowledge and understanding of its contents.

Changes made: The original clause was in present tense ("was hereunto affixed") while the rewritten one is in past tense ("was appended"). The wording has been adjusted to be less emphatic and more neutral, shifting the responsibility slightly from the individual who signed to the representative of Organic Preparations.

original: ODM Supply Agreement 11 Organic Preparations INC. & Agape ATP International Holding Limited Source: AGAPE ATP CORP, 10-K/A, 12/2/2019 SCHEDULE A – The Products at Commencement Product names:
ollama_generated:
ODM Supply Agreement 11 Organic Preparations INC. & Agape ATP International Holding Limited Source: AGAPE ATP CORP, 10-K/A, 12/2/2019 SCHEDULE A – The Products at Commencement Product names:

In this Agreement, Organic Preparations INC. (the "Supplier") shall provide the Products as listed in Schedule A to Agape ATP International Holding Limited (the "Buyer"), with the understanding that the Buyer will be responsible for ensuring the Products comply with all applicable local regulations and standards at the point of delivery, unless otherwise specified by the Supplier.

In other words, while the Supplier remains obligated to deliver the Products as stipulated in Schedule A, the Buyer assumes responsibility for verifying and complying with any necessary regulations or standards upon receipt of the Products from the Supplier. This provision is not intended to relieve the Supplier from all liability regarding the regulatory compliance of the delivered Products but rather shifts a portion of this obligation to the Buyer.

original: Product Name: Agreed Quantity of Units to be purchased per Annum:
ollama_generated:
Product Designation: Obligation to Acquire Agreed Volume of Units Annually:

This clause sets forth the contractual obligation on the part of the Purchaser to acquire the agreed volume of units each year, as specified in the attached Schedule. Any deviation from this volume shall require prior written consent from the Seller. Failure to comply with this obligation may result in the termination of this agreement by either party upon providing written notice. However, the Seller shall not be held liable for any shortages or delays in supply caused by unforeseen circumstances beyond its control.
